decodedData.FULL: REQ GM: Control Center for lock picking
decodedData.DESC:
The "expertise" is stored in the "lockpickingmod" actor value. This perk is complemented by a Reqtificator-distributed script which blocks default activation for the player and his followers on all chests and doors. If the object is locked, the script checks the expertise of the player and his buddies and then offers the appropriate options.

functionality of this perk:
255 - set sweetspot width to 0 for all locks
3x - set basic sweetspot width if expertise exceeds minimum threshold
2x - add extra sweetspot width if expertise exceeds optimum threshold

Regenerate 3 health and 1% of your Stamina per second, both in and out of beast form.
You are able to control your inner beast, therefore you are no longer forced to transform at night.
Your Werebeast Howl of the Hunt shatters locks up to Expert level at close range.
You learned how to blend in perfectly. Silver Hand Elite werewolf hunters are less likely to hunt you.
Regenerate 6 health and 2% of your Stamina per second, both in and out of beast form.
Feed on dead NPCs to retain the beast form.

You can feel how your muscles become stronger when changing into your werewolf form.
Then, they grant you a slight damage bonus.

You can feel how your muscles become even stronger when being a werewolf,
granting you a moderate damage bonus.

Your muscles are almost as hard as steel in your werewolf form,
granting you a significant damage bonus.
There remains not much that is not torn to pieces by your brute strength in werewolf form.
Power attacks in beast form cost 15% less Stamina and do 15% more damage.
Regenerate 1 health and 0.5% of your Stamina per second, both in and out of beast form.
Regenerate 2 health and 1% of your Stamina per second, both in and out of beast form.
One-Handed weapons do 40% more damage.
Regenerate an additional 1% of your maximum Health and Stamina per second, both in and out of beast form.
Give your follower the beastblood by trading Werebeast Blood with them. No effect on vampires.
No longer forced to transform at night.
Werebeast Howl of the Hunt shatters locks up to Expert level at close range.
Back hand attacks (two-handed standing power attacks) in beast form disarm targets.
The frequency of Silver Hand Elite werewolf hunters is reduced by 80%.
Regenerate an additional 2% of your maximum Health and Stamina per second, both in and out of beast form.
Feed on dead NPCs to retain the beast form.
Deal 25% more attack damage in beast form.
Additional 50 point bonus to Health and Stamina in beast form.
Able to feed off the undead in beast form, and loot their corpses.
Feeding heals 100 points more.
Werebeast Howl of Terror affects even dragons, forcing them to land for 30 seconds.
Werebeast Howl of the Hunt shatters locks up to Adept level at close range.
Werebeast Howl of Brotherhood calls Ice Wolves or Snow Bears instead.
Werebeast Howl of Brotherhood calls Werewolves or Werebears instead.
Deal 50% more attack damage in beast form.
Feeding extends beast form for longer.
Deal 75% more attack damage in beast form.
Deal 100% more attack damage in beast form.
Movement speed is increased by 10%, both in and out of beast form.
Able to turn into a Werebear.
Power attacks in beast form cost 25% less Stamina and do 25% more damage.
Feed on dead NPCs to retain the beast form.
Beast form attacks do an additional 5 points of bleed damage, healing you for the same amount.
Beast form lasts 50% longer and feeding extends the duration 50% more.
Frenzy attacks (one-handed standing power attacks) in beast form stun targets for the duration.
Allows feeding from corpses.
Beast form attacks do an additional 10 points of bleed damage, healing you for the same amount.
Power attacks in beast form can hit multiple targets in front of you.
Leap attacks (two-handed sprinting power attacks) in beast form do a critical strike equal to your Stamina and throw targets.
Werebeast Howl of Terror affects even dragons, forcing them to land for 60 seconds.
Nerfs damage during cutscene

meta.plugin: Wintersun Optional Call of the Void.esp

decodedData.DESC:
You've honestly reflected your sins, and you truly regret what pain you have inflicted upon others.
All spells cost 10% less but buying/selling prices are much higher.
Fall damage is negated
Continuously playing instruments during combat now grants additional benefits. Drums bolster your allies, while the Lute and Flute weakens your enemies' defenses.

Your mastery of musical instruments turns the tide of battle: drums inspire your allies, the flute soothes your foes, and the lute stirs chaos among your enemies. The likelihood of these effects depends on your skill with the instrument.
Your captivating performances leave the crowd in awe. The bonuses received from playing for a crowd at the inns are now doubled and last twice as long.
Your music flows as freely as the wind. Playing an instrument no longer slows your movement.
The bard's mastery over their instrument echoes through the heavens. The deep and powerful resonance of your music calls forth elemental storms, with each instrument summoning its own fury.
Your music builds to a powerful crescendo, periodically unleashing a forceful shockwave that knocks enemies back.

Consuming Ectoplasm before playing an instrument transforms music into a weapon against the undead: the drum scorches nearby undead with sunlit fury, the flute sends them fleeing in terror, and the lute banishes lesser Daedra to the void.
Alcohol makes the music flow sweeter! Alcoholic drinks no longer have negative effects, and performing under the influence enhances both your musical powers and the damage of your bardic weapons.
Gleamstrike was infused with aetherium essence in its physical form, those versed in Alteration magic will greatly increase its raw physical power.

Aetherius and Mundus once coexisted in both physical and magical planes, those who dominate the art of alteration to understand this fact, will channel Gleamstrike spells even further. (Increases damage from Gleamstrike and its spells).
The deeper understanding of the flowing magic from Aetherius resonates further into Gleamstrike. (Increases Gleamstrike spells power even further).
The corruption of the pure energy from Aetherius can bring even more power to its essence, but at what cost? (Gleamstrike physical damage and its spells can scale beyond its capacity).
Your unarmed attacks now do 7 Shock damage.
You unlock the first step to true elemental power, gaining access to fire, frost, and shock abilities.
Your firey footsteps now deal 12 damage.
Your frosty cloak gives you +60 armor and deals 12 frost damage per second.
Your mastery of all elements enables you to enhance your fire, frost, and shock spells and enchantments to do 10% more damage.
Your unarmed attacks now do 9 Shock damage.
Your unarmed attacks now do 11 Shock damage.
Your unarmed attacks now do 13 Shock damage.
Your unarmed attacks now do 15 Shock damage.
Your unarmed attacks now do 17 Shock damage.
Your unarmed attacks now do 19 Shock damage.
Your unarmed attacks now do 21 Shock damage.
Your unarmed attacks now do 23 Shock damage.
Your unarmed attacks now do 25 Shock damage. Your shock spells and enchantments do 10% more damage.
Your firey footsteps deal 14 damage.
Your firey footsteps deal 16 damage.
Your firey footsteps deal 18 damage.
Your firey footsteps deal 20 damage.
Your firey footsteps deal 22 damage.
Your firey footsteps deal 24 damage.
Your firey footsteps deal 26 damage.
Your firey footsteps deal 28 damage.
Your firey footsteps deal 30 damage.
Your frosty cloak gives you +70 armor and deals 14 frost damage per second.
Your frosty cloak gives you +80 armor and deals 16 frost damage per second.
Your frosty cloak gives you +90 armor and deals 18 frost damage per second.
Your frosty cloak gives you +100 armor and deals 20 frost damage per second.
Your frosty cloak gives you +110 armor and deals 22 frost damage per second.
Your frosty cloak gives you +120 armor and deals 24 frost damage per second.
Your frosty cloak gives you +130 armor and deals 26 frost damage per second.
Your frosty cloak gives you +140 armor and deals 28 frost damage per second.
Your frosty cloak gives you +150 armor and deals 30 frost damage per second. Your frost spells and enchantments do 10% more damage.

You have extended your repertoire of lockpicking tricks and are able to carry more loot.
[+2 Lockpicking Expertise, +25 carry weight]

You learned everything there is to know about the art of lockpicking and hauling loot.
[+2 Lockpicking Expertise, +25 Carry Weight, locks never break]

You are able to locate secret spaces in containers when you search them.
[15% chance to find special loot in select chests]

You have learned the basics of the art of picking locks and carrying found goods.
[+3 lockpicking expertise, +25 carry weight, forge lockpicks with Craftsmanship]
Gain 15% magic resistance and 150 armor rating when fighting alone.
Regenerate health, stamina and magicka 50% faster when you are fighting alone.
You resist 10% fire, frost and shock damage when fighting alone.
Deal 10% more damage when you are fighting alone.
Nearby allies, but not the player, gain 150 armor rating and 15% magical resistance.
Allies, but not the player, regenerate health, stamina and magicka 50% faster.
Nearby allies, but not the player, gain 10% resist to fire, frost and shock.
Deal 10% more damage when you are fighting with allies.

You have memorized the inner mechanics of sophisticated locks and security systems and are able to haul more loot out.
[+2 Lockpicking Expertise, +25 Carry Weight]

You've spent significant time hunting in the wilderness and can deal more damage to most animals.
Deal 20% more damage to all animals.

You've spent significant time hunting in the wilderness and can deal more damage to most animals.
Deal 40% more damage to all animals.

While others would ignore the threats of the elements, you understand the danger.
Regenerate stamina and magicka 100% faster when outdoors and out of combat.

You have mastered the outdoors and all of Skyrim's fauna. Gain a power to tame nearby animals under 50% health.
Also move 10% faster outdoors.

Your fingers have become very nimble, and besides other advantages, they allow you to
pickpocket even better and to apply poisons on your victims. Why fight if a vial of deadly venom can also do the trick?
Can pickpocket equipped weapons, arrows and staves.
Poisons placed in targets' pockets are 50% stronger when target is not detecting you.
Pickpocketing gold, keys, gems and jewelry is 50% easier. Pickpocketing sleeping targets is much easier.

Your legendary skill means you almost never get caught.
Poisons placed in pockets are 50% stronger on already poisoned targets.

You've spent some time improving your sleight of hand,
which gives you substantial chances when pickpocketing.

You have unburdened your body. You gain 100 armor rating when not wearing armor and
gain 10% armor penetration and 10 unarmed damage when unarmored.

You gain elemental resist based on how much gold you are currently carrying
[Up to 21% Fire/Frost/Shock Resist, (3% per 5k gold, maxed at 35k)]

Gain carry weight, light armor rating and sneak ability per pocket picked,
10 carry weight, 2% light armor rating and 3% sneak ability per 20 pockets picked, maxing out at 100.

You've been in and out of jail, where most people wither away you've used the time to reflect and train
Gain 5 Health, Magicka and Stamina per Jail Escapes, Up To 5 Times.

You've unburdened your inner thoughts, gaining 10% resistance to magic
and 50% greater health, stamina and magicka regen when unarmored.

You have unburdened your spirit and now shouts are 10% stronger and last 10% longer
also you are 25% more resistant to diseases and poisons when unarmored.

You have unburdened your body. You gain 200 armor rating when not wearing armor and
gain 20% armor penetration and 20 unarmed damage when unarmored.
You can now pickup and deploy Bear Traps, and craft them yourself at the forge. Bear Traps deal extra damage based on your Finesse skill.
Traps can now be poisoned.
When deploying a trap, you can consume elemental salt to coat it. Affected enemies take minor elemental damage, and on death, summon an atronach.
Your bear traps paralyze any enemy caught in their jaws, and deal a small amount of unresistable damage.

You have unburdened your body. You gain 100 armor rating when not wearing armor and
gain 10% armor penetration and 10 unarmed damage when unarmored.

You're quick thinking and even quicker with your hands
Can now create pocket sand at a forge and use it to impair enemies.
Your pocket sand can now slow down enemies, making it easier to escape combat.
Makes the game harder
Spells cost more based on difficulty
Changes Stamina cost for power attacks based on difficulty
Sneak attacks deal less damage and detection changes based on difficulty
Sneak attacks deal less damage based on difficulty
Dual casting an Alteration spell overcharges the effects into an even more powerful version.
Dual casting a Conjuration spell overcharges the spell, allowing it to last longer.
Dual casting a Destruction spell overcharges the effects into an even more powerful version.
Dual casting an Illusion spell overcharges the effects into an even more powerful version.
Dual casting a Restoration spell overcharges the effects into an even more powerful version.

You've gained the ability to act faster in combat, though doing so will quickly exhaust you.
[Lesser power: Slow time by 50% for 10 seconds, drains 15 stamina per second]

You've developed your skill for summoning undead and rasing the dead, improving their potency and duration.
[2x undead summon spell duration, stronger reanimated dead, 1.25x reanimate level limit, 5x reanimate spell duration]

Having refinined the brewing process,
your potions are now 25% stronger.

You have discovered the art of aiming at tendons and joints.
[Bows do 100% more poise damage, move forward and hold bash to perform power shot when over 200 stamina]

You've trained in the art of disarming foes mid-combat.
[20% chance to disarm when power bashing using a shield or weapon]

By gathering your strength for a short while, you can perform a much more powerful bash.
[Able to do a power bash]

You've spent quite some time improving your rhetorical skills, intimidation is much more likely to succeed
and you gain 10% better prices from the opposite gender.

You can invest gold to permanently increase the amount of gold that merchants have,
merchants will buy any non-stolen item, sell price is increased by 15%.

You've found a way to bind even more energy into inanimate matter.
[new enchantments are 10% stronger, can place two enchantments with 60% strength each, craft master level staves and scrolls, 0.8x staff charge cost]

You strengthened your shield arm and trained to parry blows a little.
[Block 25% more damage with weapons and shields, take 25% less elemental damage when blocking with a shield and 10% less with a weapon]

You've accustomed yourself to using heavy armor.
[No stamina drain for wearing heavy armor, unique bonus when wearing high-quality materials, -35% armor weight penalty]

After some training you are now much more confident in your evasive movements.
[25% less falling damage when wearing no heavy armor, unique bonus when wearing high-quality materials, -50% armor weight penalty]

You have extended your repertoire of lockpicking tricks and are able to carry more loot.
[+2 Lockpicking Expertise, +25 carry weight]

You know the basics of moving silently and are 30% harder to detect when sneaking
while not wearing any heavy armor.

You've acquired basic alchemical insights and understand how to work with a laboratory.
Thus, you can now craft your own potions and poisons.

You've learned how to deal with Skyrim's greedy merchants
Prices are better and scale 1% per speech level.

You've acquired fundamental insights into how matter and magic intertwine.
[new enchantments are 25% stronger, craft novice level staves and scrolls, can recharge weapons]
You are 60% harder to detect when sneaking while not wearing any heavy armor.

Through obscure knowledge, you now can enhance your mixtures and craft alchemistic powders at a smelter.
Besides, your sensory organs have become very keen. Thus, you determine all the alchemical properties of consumed ingredients.

You have memorized the inner mechanics of sophisticated locks and security systems and are able to haul more loot out.
[+2 Lockpicking Expertise, +25 Carry Weight]

You learned everything there is to know about the art of lockpicking and hauling loot.
[+2 Lockpicking Expertise, +25 Carry Weight]

You've perfected your spells' formulae to summon the daedra, maintaining them longer and can cast them further away.
[3x daedra summon spell duration (overwrite), 3x daedra summon spell range]
Unified perk for applying benefits from Actorvalue Modifiers

You have learned the basics of the art of picking locks and carrying found goods.
[+3 lockpicking expertise, +25 carry weight, forge lockpicks with Craftsmanship]

You have learned to draw and fire in one single movement.
[+50% draw speed with heavy bows, +100% with light bows]
You've discovered a way to make your body more resiliant to disease and poison (50% and 25% respectively)

Having studied the barriers that divide the planes of existence, you can make your summoned daedra last longer in this realm.
[2x daedra summon spell duration]
As a Vampire Lord, all spells and powers cost 10% less to cast.
As a Vampire Lord, your attacks now  absorb Health and Magicka and your damaging spells also absorb Stamina.
As a Vampire Lord, a cloud of bats absorbs 4 Health per second from each nearby living enemy in combat.

The power of undeath grants you a greater resistance to wounds,
a stronger mind and much more endurance.
As a Vampire Lord, your attacks weaken targets to your damaging spells and your damaging spells weaken targets to your attacks, increasing damage by 10% for 10 seconds.
All enchantments are 10% stronger.

You've been studying the lore and ancient script of dragons and the Thu'um.
Thus, you can shout cooldown is reduced by 10%.

Your knowledge of the realms of the dead surpasses that of many. You can raise stronger entities and they last much longer.
[3x undead summon spell duration (overwrite), 1.5x reanimate level limit (overwrite), 10x reanimate spell duration (overwrite)]

Your have familiarized yourself with the mechanics of your crossbow.
[+50% reload speed with heavy crossbows, +100% with light crossbows]

You have practiced the mental ability of maintaining two summons at the same time. This power extends to
controlling any type of conjured or conceived entity, even outside the school of Conjuration.

You've spent time meditating on the Way of the Voice, unearthing more knowledge.
Grants a dragon soul at the cost of a perk point.

You have been guided in meditating on the Thu'um.
Now your shouts linger, lasting 15% longer than they did before.

The horrors that the Thu'um can inflict are etched into your mind just as you have seen them etched into stone.
Your shouts have 15% greater magnitude.

You know what it means to be called Ysmir, Dragon of the North.
Enemy shout effects are reduced by 50%.

You've meditated thoroughly, and acquired vast insights into the Way of the Voice.
Gain a daily power that lets you use your shouts more rapidly.

You've become proficient at acting, and with the right equipment you can now disguise yourself
as a Forsworn, Imperial, Stormcloak, Necromancer, Thalmor or Warlock to (usually) avoid detection.

Your rhetorical skill makes you the perfect leader. By inspiring all those who fight by your side,
followers gain 20% damage, -15% spell cost, +75% block, +100 magicka and stamina, 50 carry weight.

You can call upon the ancient spirits for your aid. Summoned spirits are faster and stronger.
[stronger spirit summons]

You can more easily handle telekinetic spells, increasing their power and efficiency.
[1.2x magnitude, 0.8x cost for telekinetic spells]

Wind spells are stronger and more efficient.
[1.2x magnitude, 1.2x duration, 0.8x cost for wind spells]

You've learned to commune with the spirits, summoning them for extended duration.
[2x spirit summon spell duration]

You've strengthened your bond with the spirits. They can be summoned with much more ease and will last longer.
[3x spirit summon spell duration (overwrite), 0.9x spirit summon spell cost]

You can call upon the spirits to protect you, increasing your resistance to physical and magical attacks.
[+10% magic resistance and +150 armor rating while spirit summons are active]
As a Vampire Lord, upgrades your Raze spell to Blood Storm, which deals 10% more damage and can be held down for rapid fire.
Vampiric blood spells tear apart targets below 10% Health, killing them instantly.
As a Vampire Lord, your power attacks are 10% stronger and hit all targets in front of you.
Vampiric blood spells deal 0.2% more damage per level of Destruction.
Your bows, crossbows and throwing knives do 10% more damage.

Alcohol pumps you up, boosting your strength and stamina. [Requires Level 10]
[Removes Alcohol Blur, regenerate 2 stamina per second and do 10% more damage with melee attacks while tipsy]

Alcohol pumps you up, boosting your strength and stamina. [Requires Level 20]
[Removes Alcohol Blur, regenerate 3 stamina per second and do 20% more damage with melee attacks while drunk]

Having no weight on your body grants you extreme precision and reflexes.
[20% chance to avoid physical damage, +5% movement speed and +10% armor penetration when not wearing armor]

Your strong willpower provides resistance to harmful magic and more stamina. [Requires Level 20]
[+10% magic resistance when Magic Resistance perk is not taken, +20 stamina]

Your strong willpower provides resistance to harmful magic and more stamina. [Requires Level 30]
[+15% magic resistance when Magic Resistance perk is not taken, +30 stamina]

You've spent some time learning to tailor and polish gems, you are able to craft a variety of clothing items.
Also, each article of worn clothing provides additional warmth and you can polish rough gems.
No Falling damage.

You can invest gold to permanently increase the amount of gold that merchants have,
merchants will buy any non-stolen item, sell price is increased by 15%.
Bonus damage against dragons.
Bonus damage against dragons.
Bonus damage against dragons.
You take 15% less physical and magical damage from dragons.

You've gained quite some finesse, allowing you to craft plate armor and fine jewelry.
You have also found a way to melt and crush certain gems into alchemically usable dust.

The scales and bones of dragons are probably the hardest material to work with,
but you've mastered even this art since you studied The Compendium of Dragonic Armor.

You've read The Armorer's Encyclopedia and know how to properly use all kinds of tools.
You now also understand the secondary material properties of Iron and Steel weapons.

You've read The Art of Dwarven Blacksmithing and
acquired the secret knowledge of how to create and improve Dwarven equipment efficiently.

You've gained enough finesse to create and improve Elven armor and weapons
by studying the book "About Elven Craftsmanship"

Orcish equipment is hard to craft, but you've got what it takes.
By studying The Almanac of Orcish Blacksmithing, you can craft and improve it easily and most efficiently.

Crafting and improving Glass equipment is not for the unskilled,
but having studied An Introduction to Malachite, you aren't one of them any more.

Ebony weapons and armor - some even fail at heating the metal. But not you.
Now that you've studied "Harder than Steel - How to work with Ebony", you can craft and improve ebony equipment with ease.

The creation of daedric weapons and armor is a secret few mortals know - still,
you managed to acquire this knowledge by reading Daedric Craftsmanship...

You've been read An Introduction to Scale Armors,
allowing you to craft and efficiently improve scale armor.

You make steel sing songs on the anvil. Your hammer is no longer a mere tool, but a loom that weaves the fabric of myths.
You can even improve the divine artifacts of Aedra and Daedra.

After studying Arcane Craftsmanship, you've learned the
necessary techniques to craft bolts and arrows that will explode with elemental fury upon impact.

You've acquired the basics of craftsmanship and know how to properly use all kinds of tools.
You've also learned the material property of every weapon and thus they offer an extra effect.

decodedData.FULL: Lich passive for healing and potions

decodedData.DESC:
You've learned to focus your mind. Thus, you can keep your concentration even in stressful situations and regenerate your magicka faster.
[+50% magicka regeneration]

You've learned how to draw more energy from soul gems and are now able to craft them at a smelter by transmuting and melting certain minerals.
[+50% charge from soul gems, craft soul gems and apprentice level staves and scrolls]

Your understanding of enchantments allow you to use them more effectively and efficiently.
[Staves and Scrolls are 10% more powerful, enchantments cost 10% less charges]

Your understanding of enchantments allow you to use them more effectively and efficiently.
[Staves and Scrolls are 20% more powerful, enchantments cost 20% less charges]

Your understanding of enchantments allow you to use them more effectively and efficiently.
[Staves and Scrolls are 30% more powerful, enchantments cost 30% less charges]

You can use your staff to empower your own spells and cast them more efficiently.
[While holding a staff, spells are 5% more powerful and cost 10% less magicka to cast]

You can use your staff to empower your own spells and cast them more efficiently.
[While holding a staff, spells are 10% more powerful and cost 20% less magicka to cast]

You have learned to use your wand's innate mystical properties to focus your thoughts.
[+100% magicka regeneration when holding a wand]

Grants the Lion's Arrow power: Store your currently dual-cast spell. When you shoot a fully drawn bow in combat, the stored spell is released at 20% strength toward the crosshair, costing 50 Magicka. Only works with spells that target others.
Adds 40% to your pickpocket chance and increases carry weight by 100 points.
Pickpocketing bonus of 60%. Item weight and value reduce pickpocketing odds.
Pickpocketing bonus of 80%. Item weight and value reduce pickpocketing odds.
Pickpocketing bonus of 100%. Item weight and value reduce pickpocketing odds.
Power attack damage with one-handed weapons increased by 15% plus 0.1% per point of Stamina. Unlocks decapitations.
Includes level 1 Clash of Heroes.
Includes level 1 Crushing Blows.
Sideways power attacks with two-handed weapons hit all targets in front of you.
Cannot be staggered while power attacking with a one-handed weapon.
While wielding a two-handed weapon, you stagger enemies 50% longer.
Includes Level 1 Bleed Like a Lamb.
Recover twice as many arrows and bolts from dead bodies.
Armor rating of Light Armor increased by 20% if wearing a matched set of Light Armor.
Armor rating of Light Armor increased by 25% if wearing all Light Armor.
Light Armor weighs nothing and doesn't slow you down when worn.
You can improve enchanted weapons and armor.
Reduces the Stamina cost of power attacks with one-handed weapons by 15 points.
Reduces the Stamina cost of power attacks with two-handed weapons by 20 points.
Power attack damage with two-handed weapons increased by 15% plus 0.1% per point of Stamina. Unlocks decapitations.
Increases magic resistance by 10%.
Increases magic resistance by 20%.
Increases magic resistance by 30%.

Summoned and reanimated undead last three times as long (or twenty times if you place Hagraven Feathers into their inventory or use the Dread Zombie or Dead Thrall spells). Reanimated undead also gain 500 armor for 60 seconds after being reanimated.

Reanimated minions receive a brief burst of strength, dealing 200% extra attack damage for 15 seconds after being reanimated. The level cap of reanimation spells and effects is increased by 1% per level of Conjuration.
Mind affecting spells and effects cast on others are between 1 and 40 points stronger, chosen at random.
Mind affecting spells and effects are 15 points stronger (or 30 points if you are the same race as the target).
Spells and enchantments cast on others are 25% stronger or last 50% longer if the target is undead.
Includes level 1 Combustion and level 1 Scarring Burns.
Includes level 1 Merciless Cold and level 1 Frostfall.
Magicka regenerates 25% faster.
Magicka regenerates 50% faster.

If wearing robes and no light or heavy armor, reduces incoming attack and elemental damage by 35% but you lose Magicka equal to the amount of Health lost. The damage reduction gradually diminishes as Magicka falls below half. The energy shield is disabled when your hands are lowered.
Restoration spells are up to 30% more powerful if the recipient is below half Health. The bonus increases as Health decreases.
Healing spells also restore Stamina equal to their power.

When you gain an armor spell in combat (or enter combat with an active armor spell), you become intangible and unable to be affected by spells or attacks for 10 seconds or until you perform an offensive or defensive action.
All spells you cast from any school of magic are silent to others.
Includes Level 1 Ionized Path and level 1 Static Field.
Can pickpocket equipped weapons. If the target is sleeping, can pickpocket any equipped item.
Adds 25% to your chance to pickpocket gold, keys and jewelry.
Pickpocketing gold is 50% easier.
Can pickpocket equipped items.
Pick starts much closer to the lock opening position.

Your skill at lockpicking is such that you may bypass locks of Expert or lower level without using a key or manually picking the lock. After picking or bypassing at least 100 locks, you gain 2 perk points.
Find 20-100 more gold in many dungeon chests and 2-10 more gold in some corpses, urns, etc.
You won't trigger pressure plates.
Sneak attacks with one-handed weapons deal 100% more damage. Sneak attacks with any other weapon or fists deal 25% more damage.
Sneak attacks with daggers deal 1% more damage per level of Sneak.

When you gain invisibility, places a barrel of flammable booze at your location. When you lose invisibility, it explodes, dealing fire damage equal to 200% of your Sneak skill level and staggering targets. This effect has a 15 second cooldown.
Entering sneak mode in combat grants 2 seconds of invisibility, briefly leaving combat and forcing distant opponents to search for you. This effect has an 8 second cooldown.
You may choose a type of beneficial potion: Health, Magicka or Stamina. Potions you mix that restore or fortify the chosen attribute are 50% stronger.
Potions you mix with beneficial effects have an additional 25% greater magnitude.
Poisons you mix are 1% more powerful per level of Alchemy.
Eating an ingredient reveals all effects.
All negative effects are removed from created potions, and all positive effects are removed from created poisons.
Pressing Block while aiming will zoom in your view.
Arrows and bolts have a chance to stagger a target within 50 feet. More effective against targets with a lower remaining Health percentage. No effect on massive targets.
Can move at full speed with a drawn bow. (Do not take this perk while sneaking.)
Arrows and bolts slow a target within 25 feet by 10% for 20 seconds. This effect stacks.
Able to do a power bash by holding down Attack while blocking.
While blocking with a shield or weapon, arrows do half damage. Arrows that hit the shield do no damage.
Blocking with a shield reduces incoming fire, frost, and shock damage by 50%.
Able to sprint with a shield raised. This knocks enemies in your path to the ground, but costs 10 points of Stamina per second. Enemies can only be affected once every 10 seconds.

Tired enemies have a harder time defeating your armor. You take up to 20% less attack damage from enemies with half or less Stamina, if wearing all Heavy Armor. The lower their Stamina, the less damage you take.
Heavy Armor weighs half as much and slows you down half as much when worn.
Increases unarmed damage by 5% of your current Stamina, and you gain Light Armor experience when using unarmed attacks in combat. Requires two free hands.
Armor rating of Heavy Armor increased by 25% if wearing all Heavy Armor.
Can bribe guards to ignore crimes.
Buy items for 15% less when trading with the same race.
Can barter stolen goods with any merchant.
Can sell any type of item to any kind of merchant.
Can invest 500 gold with a shopkeeper to increase his or her available gold by 500 permanently.
Death blows with enchanted weapons to creatures, but not people, trap 5% of the victim's soul, recharging the weapon. Does not apply to staves.

Grants the "Hawkeye" power. Once a day, slow time and focus on your foes for 10 seconds, looking for opportunities for a killing shot. Finding their vulnerability takes 1 second per 125 Health. Once you do, you may shoot them for an instant kill.

Able to upgrade many types of arrows at a forge or anvil, adding a bonus effect (Force, Immolation, Freezing, Grounding, Maze or Death) based on its material.

You no longer need to wear a helmet to benefit from perks that require "wearing all Light Armor". If you are not wearing a helmet, Light Armor pieces have 20% increased armor rating.

Your agility enables you to strike more effectively, granting 20% more attack damage and critical damage if wearing all Light Armor. This effect is lost for 6 seconds whenever you get struck by an unblocked attack or a hostile spell in combat.
If wearing all Light Armor, jump in combat to cause all incoming attacks and spells to miss for 1 second. This effect has a 5 second cooldown.
If wearing all Heavy Armor, take 30% less attack damage from power attacks.
You gain 20% movement speed if you are not blocking during an enemy's power attack. If the power attack misses, the effect lasts until combat ends or until you get struck by a power attack.

You take no damage from falling if wearing all Heavy Armor.
When struck by a power attack or power bash, your attacks deal 125% more damage to the attacker for 5 seconds if wearing all Heavy Armor.

Grants the "Rallying Standard" power. Once a day, place a banner that grants 150 points of armor and 25% melee damage to allies within 25 feet wearing all Heavy Armor (including you) and prevents them from fleeing. Lasts 60 seconds.

You are immune to basic melee weapon perks (Clash of Champions/Heroes, Denting/Crushing Blows, Bleed Like a Lamb/Dog, Bite Marks). If wearing all Heavy Armor, you take 10% less attack damage from enemies affected by one or more of these perks.
Incoming fire, frost and shock damage reduced by 0.02% per point of armor if wearing all Heavy Armor.
If wearing all Heavy Armor, walking (but not running) towards living enemies within 30 feet in front of you may break their confidence, causing them to flee for 8 seconds.
If wearing all Heavy Armor, you intimidate enemies within 15 feet. They lose 5% attack damage and you gain 5% attack damage for each enemy affected.

Sprinting in combat increases the armor of allied people within 20 feet by 25% of your own armor, and the armor of allied Skeletons created by Bone Collector within 20 feet by 15% of your own armor. Lasts 30 seconds.
When struck by an attack, subsequent attacks are deflected if wearing all Heavy Armor. You take 75% reduced damage from attacks for 1 second.
Unarmed power attacks do 25% more damage. Additionally, if your movement speed is increased, they do 2% damage per 1% movement speed. Requires two free hands.
Increases unarmed damage by 15% of your current Stamina, and you gain Light Armor experience when using unarmed attacks in combat. Requires two free hands.
Block 10% more damage.
Block 20% more damage.

Assume a defensive position for 1 second after raising your shield or weapon, blocking 30% more damage and staggering attackers in melee range. (If you do not block an attack during this time, you cannot attempt another Timed Block for 2 seconds.)

Assume a defensive position for 1 second after raising your shield or weapon, blocking 30% more damage and staggering attackers in melee range. (If you do not block an attack during this time, you cannot attempt another Timed Block for 1 second.)
After a successful Timed Block, bashing the attacker within 5 seconds deals double damage.
Perform a Timed Block to mitigate incoming fire, frost and shock spells and effects, reducing their damage by 50%.

Power bashing with a weapon infuriates living targets for 30 seconds. They won't flee from combat but can't regenerate Stamina, lose 15 points of Stamina per second and you take no damage from their attacks during a Timed Block.

Performing 3 successful Timed Blocks in a row completes a Timing Streak, restoring 75 points of Stamina. (Taking an unblocked attack or blocking an attack outside the timed block window breaks the combo.)
Completing a Timing Streak violently disarms the last attacker, staggering all within an 8 foot radius.
During a Timed Block, allies within 10 feet gain 250 points of armor rating.
You take no damage from attacks during a Timed Block as long as you have Stamina remaining.
Take 25% less attack damage from any direction when blocking in combat.

You take 30% less damage from blocked attacks while Wardancer is active. When you lose the Wardancer effect due to an unblocked attack, it also deals 30% less damage.
When you get struck by an unblocked attack or hostile spell in combat, an adrenaline rush regenerates 5% of your maximum Stamina per second for 6 seconds if wearing all Light Armor.
Interrupting an attack with a power bash with a shield knocks the attacker to the ground. Targets can only be affected once every 30 seconds.
After a successful Timed Block within 8 feet, you may retaliate with increased strength, increasing your attack damage and critical strike damage against the attacker by 25% for 5 seconds.
While sprinting in Light Armor, you cannot be staggered and take 50% less damage from power attacks.
Completing a Timing Streak grants 10% extra attack damage for 90 seconds. This effect stacks.
Perform a Timed Block to mitigate incoming fire, frost and shock spells and effects, reducing their damage to zero.
When you get struck by an unblocked attack or hostile spell in combat, gain 10% movement speed for 6 seconds if wearing all Light Armor.
Your critical strikes deal 75% more critical damage for 10 seconds after entering combat while wearing all Light Armor.
When you enter combat, if wearing all Light Armor, regenerate up to 20% of your maximum Stamina per second. This bonus gradually diminishes over the course of 15 seconds.
Bows and crossbows do 25% more damage.
Bows and crossbows do 50% more damage, and critical strikes with bows and crossbows do 2% more critical damage per level of Archery.
One-handed weapons do 25% more damage.

You take half damage from enemy attacks while power attacking with a two-handed weapon.

Grants the "Lion's Arrow" power: use it to store the spell you are dual casting. Shooting a fully drawn bow in combat also releases the stored spell in the direction of the crosshair. Only works with spells that affect other targets.

When fighting only one enemy, hitting the target with a bow or crossbow manifests a Spirit Wolf for 30 seconds. The wolf deals damage equal to 15% of your current Stamina. This effect has a 30 second cooldown per target.
You take 20% less attack damage from enemies with full Health if wearing all Light Armor.
Standing power attacks with a war axe remove all active instances of Wolfstooth on the user, dealing 50% bonus damage and a critical strike for 250% bonus critical damage for each instance consumed.

Repeated standing power attacks with a sword against a target do escalating damage if no more than 3 seconds pass between each. This effect stacks up to three times, each doing 15% more damage. Reaching four stacks knocks the target off their feet.

Each standing power attack with a mace that hits a target empowers subsequent standing power attacks with a mace within 20 seconds, increasing their damage and Stamina cost by 15%. This effect stacks.
Standing power attacks with a greatsword fatigue a target, draining 150 points of Magicka and Stamina and halting regeneration for 5 seconds.
Standing power attacks with a battleaxe deal bonus damage equal to 15% of a target's current Health.
Whenever a standing power attack with a warhammer inflicts a critical strike, it deals 3% more critical damage per point of Stamina.
Cast Restoration spells for 35% less Magicka, and Restoration spells are 0.25% more powerful per level of Restoration.
